text: What is your company's current stage of AI adoption?
options: No formal AI initiatives; Exploring AI possibilities; Pilot projects in progress; Limited production deployment; Widespread AI implementation; AI-first organization

text: Does your organization have a dedicated AI strategy or roadmap?
options: No formal strategy; Strategy under development; Strategy defined but not implemented; Strategy partially implemented; Comprehensive strategy fully implemented

text: Who leads AI initiatives in your organization?
options: No designated leadership; IT Department; Data Science team; Chief Technology Officer; Chief Data Officer; Dedicated Chief AI Officer; Board-level oversight

text: What is your organization's annual budget allocated to AI and data initiatives?
options: No dedicated budget; Less than £50k; £50k - £250k; £250k - £1M; £1M - £5M; £5M+; Prefer not to disclose

text: How would you rate your organization's data governance maturity?
options: No formal data governance; Basic policies in place; Defined governance framework; Governance actively monitored; Advanced governance with automation; World-class data governance

text: What percentage of your organization's data is considered high quality and readily accessible for analysis?
Does your organization have established data privacy and compliance frameworks?
options: GDPR compliance; CCPA compliance; Industry-specific regulations (HIPAA
column8: etc.); Internal data privacy policies; Regular compliance audits; Data anonymization processes; None of the above

text: How is data currently stored and managed in your organization?
options: On-premises databases; Cloud data warehouses; Data lakes; Hybrid cloud solutions; Legacy systems; Real-time streaming platforms; Excel spreadsheets; Other

text: What cloud platforms does your organization currently use or plan to use for AI/ML workloads?
options: Amazon Web Services (AWS); Microsoft Azure; Google Cloud Platform; IBM Cloud; Oracle Cloud; Private cloud solutions; Hybrid cloud approach; No cloud strategy; Other

text: What is your organization's current capability in the following areas?
options: Machine Learning model development; Natural Language Processing; Computer Vision; Predictive Analytics; Robotic Process Automation; Business Intelligence; Real-time data processing; API development and management

text: How many employees in your organization have formal training or experience in AI/ML?
options: None; 1-5 employees; 6-20 employees; 21-50 employees; 51-100 employees; More than 100 employees; Unsure

text: What is your organization's approach to AI/ML talent acquisition?
options: Hiring external AI specialists; Training existing employees; Partnering with universities; Using consulting services; Developing internal academies; Acquiring AI-focused companies; No formal approach; Other

text: What are the primary barriers to AI adoption in your organization?
options: Lack of technical expertise; Insufficient data quality; Budget constraints; Regulatory concerns; Cultural resistance; Unclear ROI; Data security concerns; Legacy system limitations; Lack of executive support

text: How does your organization approach AI ethics and responsible AI?
options: No formal approach; Considering ethical implications; Developing ethical guidelines; Ethical review process in place; Comprehensive ethics framework; Independent ethics oversight

text: What measures are in place for AI system monitoring and governance?
options: Model performance monitoring; Bias detection and mitigation; Audit trails for AI decisions; Regular model retraining; Human oversight requirements; Explainability standards; Risk assessment protocols; None of the above

text: What are your organization's primary goals for AI implementation over the next 2 years?
options: Improve operational efficiency; Enhance customer experience; Reduce costs; Drive innovation; Gain competitive advantage; Improve decision making; Automate routine tasks; Develop new revenue streams; Other

text: In which business areas do you see the greatest potential for AI impact?
options: Customer service; Marketing and sales; Finance and accounting; Human resources; Operations and supply chain; Product development; Risk management; Legal and compliance; Research and development; Other

What external partnerships or vendors are you working with for AI initiatives?
